lines.text: How do you know I won't murder you in the night?

[remains calm]
Well, how do you know I won't murder you?
Nah...
You have faith in me it seems. And I must have faith in you, musnt' I? Good night.
You know what is going to happen, don't you? I will take you in the end!

[to an old woman]
You want to know who I am? I'm a convict! Yeah! I served my sentence. Now my punishment begins, it seems. Look, in prison they gave me a bed of wood. Now I have one of stone.
[laughs]
That's what they do when they set you free!
[laughs]
Well, call the police, why don't you? Have me turned off this as well!

[dying in bed]
Oh, Monsieur Madeliene, you give everything!
Is it true I don't have to go back to the galleys? You - you let me go free?
Free? When is a man free? I wish someone would tell me.
You never temper justice with mercy?
No, we might as well understand each other, Monsieur Madeliene. I administer the law - good, bad, or indifferent - it's no business of mine, but the law to the letter!

[inciting the crowd]
We'll tear up the streets of Paris! If they've got bayonets, we've got knives!
And me! Me! Have you nothing for me?

But you're my father. I mean I always think of you as my father. I know you're not really, but, don't you see, with Marius, it's different. It isn't just that lovely sense of companionship I have with you. It's - it's - well, it's the way every girl feels for the man who's going to marry her! You always knew I should have to leave you one day, didn't you?
No one forgets that!

[seeing an apparent stranger in the midst of the broiling student rebeels]
Who are you?

[absentmindedly as he looks in the crowd for Valjean]
What'd ya say?
Spy? Police!
I might be a spy, and I'm certainly the police.
[the students rush Javert and subdue him]

[looking around the empty hallway]
Javert? You're here! I know it! Where are you? Where are you?
I'm ready. All I ask is a few minutes to say good-bye.
The law allows you nothing.

[holding the Bishop's candlesticks]
Keep these always. Silver they say, but they're more than gold to me!
Right or wrong, the law is the law and it must be obeyed to the letter.
Long ago, Jean, I learned that life is to give, not to take. Let me give. And in return, promise me that you will give, also.
If that thing on your face is a smile, take it off and get on with your work!
Remember to love each other, always. There's scarcely anything else in life but that.
life is to give, not to take.
